Description: A figure of a squatting baboon: cut out of a thin sheet of glazed composition. The legs and neck are indicated by incised lines and the snout has been rounded at the top. The green glaze has partly decayed to brown, and has been chipped at the feet.
Curator's comments: For another example of a baboon-figure made in this way, see B. Adams, 'Ancient Hierakonpolis' (Warminster, 1974), 27, no. 136 and pl.20. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), 25 (not illustrated).
